title: Getting "invalid syntax" errors - foreach loops, quietly, noisily, capture.
body:
#### Problem description

Using atom and hydrogen, I suddenly  get "invalid syntax r(198);" errors when executing code.

Context: I have been using stata_kernel with atom and hydrogen for nearly a year without this issue. This started happening after my computer ran out of hard disk space and STATA started throwing an error message. I deleted some unrelated files and cleared some space. That error disappeared, but now this error keeps popping up. I've updated the kernel, I're restarted everything many times and the problem is persistent. 

Only the most simple commands execute without a problem. I cannot use quietly, noisily or capture either without this error. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45105185/93109968-b15c0280-f682-11ea-9c11-d30152787516.png)

There are no such problem when I launch STATA and use it directly. 

#### Debugging log

See attached. 
[console_debug.log](https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel/files/5219692/console_debug.log)

Looking at it, it seems like a problem with include.do?



. `acf5410dffcb668adf37da696e87d400'
. _StataKernelLog on

. `d450cfde56d6cad2042c8f0870cc76f5'
. include C:/Users/Dan Fridman/.stata_kernel_cache/include.do
invalid syntax
r(198);

. `d1d0b5544eadcba44c5f1aa5695588da'
. display "test"
test

. `85a27f55e74d4469106bf93a0d482706'
. include C:/Users/Dan Fridman/.stata_kernel_cache/include.do
invalid syntax
r(198);

. `cc64df03024327541235dabb93f09e00'
. _StataKernelLog off

#### Code Sample

```stata
clear all

display "test"

foreach i in 1 2 3 4 {
	display "`i'"
}
```
